alert.note: Alert for Allendale; Hampton; Inland Colleton (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 11 at 1:17AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF HAMPTON, COLLETON AND ALLENDALE COUNTIES... At 117 AM EST, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm over Almeda Intersection, or near Hampton, moving north at 40 mph. HAZARD...strong winds 45 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar Indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Some locations in the path of this storm include... Allendale, Hampton, Lake Warren State Park, Varnville, Fairfax, Brunson, Gifford and Sycamore. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: A tornado watch is in effect. Thunderstorms can produce tornadoes suddenly, sometimes with little or no warning. Be alert for rapidly changing weather conditions and be ready to act quickly if severe weather is observed or a warning is issued. Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so. You can also email your report to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
